results.adx_keywords: internal-open-access;Sheriffs;Sex Crimes;Prisons and Prisoners;Police Brutality, Misconduct and Shootings;Terry Grassaree;Noxubee County jail;Mississippi;Macon (Miss)
results.byline: By Ilyssa Daly and Jerry Mitchell
results.title: Sex Abuse, Beatings and an Untouchable Mississippi Sheriff
results.abstract: As abuse allegations in a rural jail piled up, criminal inquiries dragged on or went nowhere. No one scrutinized how the sheriff ran his jail.

media.caption: At least eight men — including four deputies and former Sheriff Terry Grassaree — have been accused of sexual abuse by women being held in the Noxubee County jail while Mr. Grassaree was in charge.
media.copyright: Rory Doyle for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Louisville, Ky, Bank Shooting (April 2023);Beshear, Andrew G (1977- );Sturgeon, Connor (1998-2023);Old National Bank (Louisville, Ky);Louisville (Ky)
results.title: What We Know About the Louisville, Ky., Bank Shooting
results.abstract: The gunman told at least one person that he was suicidal before the rampage that killed five people, and the police said he legally purchased the AR-15-style rifle a week earlier.

media.caption: The scene at Old National Bank in downtown Louisville, Ky., on Monday, where the police said a 25-year-old man shot and killed five colleagues.

results.adx_keywords: Comic Books and Strips;Magazines;Art;Deaths (Obituaries);Cartoons and Cartoonists;Jaffee, Al;Mad Magazine
results.title: Al Jaffee, Inventive Cartoonist at Mad Magazine, Dies at 102
results.abstract: For 55 years he created the fold-in (as opposed to, say, Playboy’s fold-out), giving readers a satirical double-take on whatever was going on in the news.

media.caption: Al Jaffee at work in 2008. In 2007, he won cartooning’s top honor, putting him in the company of Charles M. Schulz, Mort Walker, Gary Larson, Matt Groening and others.

results.title: Gunman Who Killed Five in Louisville Left Note and Bought Rifle Legally

results.title: In the Fight Over How to Teach Reading, This Guru Makes a Major Retreat
results.abstract: Lucy Calkins, a leading literacy expert, has rewritten her curriculum to include a fuller embrace of phonics and the science of reading. Critics may not be appeased.

media.caption: Lucy Calkins, an education professor, created a popular curriculum called “Units of Study,” built on a vision of children as natural readers and writers.
media.copyright: Evelyn Freja for The New York Times

results.title: These Devices Save Lives, but Almost Nobody Has One at Home
results.abstract: While researchers are divided over whether more people should have automated external defibrillators at home, those who have used one have no doubts.

media.copyright: Ash Ponders for The New York Times

results.title: Passenger Flight Is Diverted After Woman Threatens Flight Attendant
results.abstract: An Alaska Airlines flight from San Francisco to Chicago landed in Kansas City, Mo., after the passenger started acting erratically. She was arrested on a federal charge.

media.caption: The incident involving an unruly passenger took place aboard an Alaska Airlines flight last Friday, federal authorities said.

results.abstract: Some people who’ve walked away from China’s grueling corporate culture say it’s worth the financial sacrifice. “I was tired of living like that,” one said.

media.caption: At a job fair in Wuhan, China, in February.

results.abstract: Nora Ephron once wrote, “Our faces are lies and our necks are the truth.” What do skin experts have to say?

results.title: Is There Life After Influencing?
results.abstract: The internet personality Lee From America wanted to see what life was like as plain old Lee Tilghman. She’s not alone. But leaving behind lucrative brand partnerships and high follower counts is harder than it looks.

results.title: To Become Oscar Levant, Sean Hayes Revisited His First Role
results.abstract: Years before “Will & Grace,” Hayes was a classical pianist. In the new Broadway play “Good Night, Oscar,” he returns to the piano to portray a famously troubled musician and witty guest of late-night TV shows.

media.caption: Sean Hayes at the Steinway Hall showroom in Manhattan. “The mental health issues are in my family,” Hayes said. “Addictions are in my family. I thought, maybe I can wrap my head around this thing. As an actor, that’s what we do.”

results.title: Biden Administration Proposes Evenly Cutting Water Allotments From Colorado River
results.abstract: As the river shrinks, the Biden administration is getting ready to impose, for the first time, reductions in water supplies to states.

media.caption: Water intake towers at the Hoover Dam. Last summer, the water level at Lake Mead, created by the dam on the Colorado River, reached its lowest level ever.
